{"step_by_step_thinking": "The child presented with severe itching over the web of fingers, more at night, and examination revealed burrows. These findings are highly suggestive of scabies. Tinea cruris is a fungal infection that typically affects the groin area, not the fingers. Infantile eczema usually presents with erythematous patches and excoriations, but not burrows. Papular urticaria is characterized by itchy papules or wheals, but not burrows. Therefore, the most probable diagnosis in this case is B. Scabies.", "answer_choice": "B"}
